intro: Leichhardtia brevifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leichhardtia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in dry, open habitats. Leichhardtia brevifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray.
